documents.content:
# Well Permit Requirements in California (2026)

## Who Issues Well Permits?

Well permits are issued by **county environmental health departments**, not the State Water Board.

## When Permits are Required

### Activities Requiring Permits
- Drilling new wells
- Deepening existing wells
- Modifying or repairing wells
- Destroying/abandoning wells
- Converting well use (agricultural to domestic, etc.)

### Types of Wells
- Domestic water supply
- Agricultural/irrigation
- Industrial
- Monitoring wells
- Cathodic protection wells

## General Permit Process

### Step 1: Contact County
- Find your county environmental health department
- Request permit application
- Discuss project requirements

### Step 2: Submit Application
- Well location and property information
- Proposed well specifications
- Licensed well driller information
- Site plan/map
- Application fee

### Step 3: Permit Review
- County reviews for:
  - Setback requirements (from septic, property lines, etc.)
  - Flood zone considerations
  - Environmental sensitivity
  - SGMA basin requirements (if applicable)

### Step 4: Permit Issuance
- Permits valid for specific time period
- Must use licensed C-57 contractor
- Well completion report required

## Typical County Fees

*Fees vary significantly by county*

| Permit Type | Typical Range |
|-------------|---------------|
| New domestic well | $200 - $1,000 |
| Agricultural well | $300 - $1,500 |
| Well destruction | $100 - $500 |
| Permit renewal | $50 - $200 |

## Setback Requirements (Typical)

| From | Minimum Distance |
|------|------------------|
| Septic tank/leach field | 100 feet |
| Sewer line | 50 feet |
| Property line | 5-10 feet |
| Other wells | Varies |

*Check county-specific requirements*

## SGMA Considerations

In SGMA-regulated basins:
- Additional permits may be required from GSA
- Well registration/reporting may be mandatory
- Extraction fees may apply
- Check with local Groundwater Sustainability Agency

## Licensed Contractors

Well work must be performed by licensed:
- **C-57 Well Drilling Contractor**, or
- **C-61/D21 Limited Specialty**

Verify license at: [Checklicense.Aspx](https://www.cslb.ca.gov/onlineservices/checklicenseII/checklicense.aspx)

## After Drilling

### Well Completion Report
- Filed by driller with DWR
- Copies to county and property owner
- Public record (location data may be confidential)

### Water Quality Testing
- Recommended for domestic wells
- Test for bacteria, nitrates, other contaminants
- County may require before occupancy

## Resources

**Find Your County:** [Well Permit Requirements by County](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/)
**DWR Well Completion Reports:** [DWR Wells Program](https://water.ca.gov/Programs/Groundwater-Management/Wells)

## Take Action
1. Learn more at [Wells](https://water.ca.gov/Programs/Groundwater-Management/Wells).
2. Learn more at [Checklicense.Aspx](https://www.cslb.ca.gov/onlineservices/checklicenseII/checklicense.aspx).
3. Learn more at [Well Permit Requirements by County](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/).
